alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 6:02PM EDT until July 21 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Franklin County in northwestern Vermont... * Until 900 PM EDT. * At 602 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain and water ponding on the road at Orchard St and Route 105. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Enosburg Falls, Berkshire, Enosburg Falls Village, Enosburg, Franklin, Sheldon, Richford, Fairfield, North Enosburg, West Berkshire, Enosburg Center, South Franklin, West Enosburg and East Sheldon. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
